snippet: A new survey of six World’s Fairs held in the United States in the 1930s shows that they took the promise of progress seriously.
abstract: Edward Rothstein reviews Designing Tomorrow exhibition, survey of six World's Fairs held in the United States in the 1930s, at the Museum of the City of New York.
lead_paragraph: A new survey of six World’s Fairs held in the United States in the 1930s shows that they took the promise of progress seriously.

headline.seo: World’s Fairs of 1930s Showed Boundless Vision of Prosperity
headline.main: Yesterday’s Tomorrows, Full of Rosy Visions
headline.print_headline: Yesterday’s Tomorrows, Full of Rosy Visions

keywords.value: Museum of the City of New York
